value.title: Learn the business value of Microsoft Azure
value.excerpt: Are you interested in learning about the cloud in an easy to understand way? Or perhaps you are confused about where to begin with cloud technology? This learning path introduces you to digital transformation, what Azure is, and all the different ways it can meet your business needs.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure solutions
topItems.excerpt: Get started with your digital transformation by exploring why now is the right time to begin, why Azure is the right platform, and how Azure can bring overall value to your organization. We'll demonstrate key scenarios that illustrate how digital transformation with Azure can empower employees, engage customers, optimize operations, and transform products.

topItems.title: Applications and infrastructure migration and modernization
topItems.excerpt: Every modern business is powered by applications, such as internal procurement applications, Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems, retail websites, and third-party products. As your business prepares for digital transformation, it’s important to begin modernizing and migrating your applications and infrastructure to the cloud. Azure is a key component of that process. You can choose to migrate, modernize, or build cloud native solutions depending on your business goals and how you assess your application portfolio. This is a strategic decision. You’ll be able to choose the path that’s right for your organization.

topItems.title: Microsoft data estate migration and modernization
topItems.excerpt: Establishing a modern data estate is a foundational step toward digital transformation. A modern data estate enables timely insights and decision making across all your data, and sets the foundation for AI. A data estate is all of the data an organization owns. When you migrate this data to the cloud or modernize your environment on-premises you can gain important insights to fuel innovation.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Artificial Intelligence (AI) strategy and solutions
topItems.excerpt: This module provides an overview of Azure AI and demonstrates how Microsoft tools, services, and infrastructure can help make AI real for your organization, whether you want to unlock insights from your latent data with knowledge mining, develop your own AI models with machine learning, or build immersive apps using AI.

value.title: Migrate ASP.NET Apps to Azure
value.excerpt: Migrate ASP.NET web applications and their data to Azure App Service and Azure SQL Database to take advantage of the cloud.

topItems.title: Introduction to migrating ASP.NET apps to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Migrating an ASP.NET application from on-premises to Azure, along with a supporting Azure SQL database, can provide many advantages, but also challenges. Learn how to evaluate the migration process to determine if it’s right for your application.

topItems.title: Host a web application with Azure App service
topItems.excerpt: Create a website in the programming language of your choice through the hosted web app platform in Azure App Service.

topItems.title: Provision an Azure SQL database to store application data
topItems.excerpt: Find out what makes Azure SQL Database a good choice for your relational database, how to create the database from the portal and connect with Azure Cloud Shell.

topItems.title: Migrate an on-premises web application to Azure App Service
topItems.excerpt: Use the Azure App Service Migration Assistant to assess the readiness of a web app to be deployed on App Service, and perform the migration.

value.title: SAP certified offerings for Azure
value.excerpt: As an IT Professional experienced in SAP solutions, you need to learn about how to leverage Azure resources that include virtual machines, virtual networks, storage accounts, and Azure AD. These modules will give you the Azure knowledge around SAP Workloads, the certified offerings in Azure, and how to utilize IAAS support for your SAP workloads.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure for SAP workloads
topItems.excerpt: With the recently expanded partnership between Microsoft and SAP, you can run SAP applications across development, test, and production scenarios in Azure, taking advantage of the scalability, flexibility, and cost savings of Microsoft Azure.

topItems.title: Deploy SAP certified offerings on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Azure provides a scalable, compliant, and enterprise-proven platform for a range of SAP workloads. In this module, you explore the platform compliance criteria that is stipulated by SAP before deploying SAP solutions in Azure, and look at the different options for deploying SAP in Azure.

topItems.title: Using IAAS support with Azure for SAP workloads
topItems.excerpt: There are a variety of commonly used SAP-certified operating systems supported by SAP running on Azure VMs, and there are also several different methods of provisioning storage for SAP workloads in Azure. In this module, you will learn the SAP recommended support products and VM types as well as the network, database, and monitoring requirements.

topItems.title: SAP HANA on Azure Compute, Network, and Storage
topItems.excerpt: AP HANA on Azure (Large Instances) provides virtual machines for deploying and running SAP HANA. This module explores the SAP HANA on Azure (Large Instances) solution that builds on assigned, non -shared host/server bare -metal hardware.

value.title: Work with NoSQL data in Azure Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: In this learning path, find out how to customize NoSQL data storage and distribution with the Azure portal, Cosmos DB extension, and Cosmos DB .NET Core SDK.

topItems.title: Create an Azure Cosmos DB database built to scale
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create an Azure Cosmos DB account, database, and container built to scale as your application grows.

topItems.title: Choose the appropriate API for Azure Cosmos DB
topItems.excerpt: Compare the different APIs that are available in Azure Cosmos DB, highlighting and contrasting the different scenarios that would make them a good choice for a company.

topItems.title: Insert and query data in your Azure Cosmos DB database
topItems.excerpt: Discover the Azure Cosmos DB Data Explorer tool that enables you to add or modify data. Create stored procedures in JavaScript.

topItems.title: Store and access graph data in Azure Cosmos DB with the Graph API
topItems.excerpt: Find out about creating an application with Azure Cosmos DB as a graph database, then retrieve, manipulate, and visualize graph data using Data Explorer.

value.title: Accelerate cloud adoption with the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure
value.excerpt: Do you need a clear path forward for your cloud journey? This learning path includes best practice guidance to help you create a cloud strategy, define a cloud adoption plan, prepare your cloud environment with proper governance, and implement cloud operations in alignment with your organizational needs.  Cloud architects and IT professionals will learn and engage with the proven best practices, tools, and documentation in the Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure to build the technical knowledge needed to help your organization successfully adopt the cloud and meet business goals.

topItems.title: Getting started with the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure
topItems.excerpt: CAF getting started. Use the Cloud Adoption Framework getting started guides to unblock your organization’s cloud adoption efforts

topItems.title: Prepare for successful cloud adoption with a well-defined strategy
topItems.excerpt: Success in cloud adoption is predicated by a clear strategy that helps the team understand executive direction and regularly measure progress. This module will help capture the cloud adoption strategy needed to drive your success.

topItems.title: CAF Plan: Prepare for cloud adoption with a data-driven plan.
topItems.excerpt: Prepare for cloud adoption with a data driven, cloud adoption plan from CAF. For new innovations, learn from others who have used the target platforms. For migrations, understand how to evaluate your assets and plan the efforts required to move them to the cloud.

topItems.title: Choose the best Azure landing zone to support your cloud operations requirements
topItems.excerpt: Azure landing zones help accelerate configuration of your environment to meet your operational requirements.

value.title: AZ-400: Facilitate communication and collaboration
value.excerpt: Explore DevOps capabilities such as continuous planning and continuous collaboration and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Analyze DevOps Continuous Planning and Continuous Integration
topItems.excerpt: Explore the first two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Planning and Continuous Integration.

topItems.title: Introduce the foundation pillars of DevOps: Culture and Lean Product
topItems.excerpt: DevOps is the union of people, process, and products to enable continuous delivery of value to our end users. Discover the first two foundation pillars of DevOps: Culture and Lean Product.

topItems.title: Characterize DevOps Continuous Collaboration and Continuous Improvement
topItems.excerpt: Explore two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Collaboration and Continuous Improvement.

topItems.title: Explain DevOps Continuous Delivery and Continuous Quality
topItems.excerpt: Explore two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Delivery and Continuous Quality.

value.title: Azure Static Web Apps
value.excerpt: Azure Static Web Apps is a modern web app service that offers streamlined full-stack development from source code to global high availability.

topItems.title: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app with Azure Static Web Apps
topItems.excerpt: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app with Azure Static Web Apps. Use Visual Studio Code to create and run the web app locally.

topItems.title: Publish an API to Azure Static Web Apps
topItems.excerpt: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app and API with Azure Static Web Apps and Azure Functions. Deploy your code from GitHub to a staging site using preview URLs.

topItems.title: Publish a Blazor WebAssembly app and .NET API with Azure Static Web Apps
topItems.excerpt: Publish a Blazor WebAssembly app and .NET API with Azure Static Web Apps

topItems.title: Create and publish a static web app with Gatsby and Azure Static Web Apps
topItems.excerpt: Use Gatsby to develop and compile a static web app, then deploy it to the web with Azure Static Web Apps.

value.title: Build automated workflows to integrate data and apps with Azure Logic Apps
value.excerpt: This learning path guides you through creation of serverless workflows for your organization using Azure Logic Apps, a cloud service that automates your business processes.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Logic Apps
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to evaluate Logic Apps as an automation choice for your organization using criteria for integration, performance, conditionals, and connectors.

topItems.title: Route and process data automatically using Logic Apps
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to define a workflow to run your business with Logic apps using built-in triggers, actions, and conditional operators.

topItems.title: Call an API from a Logic Apps workflow using a custom connector
topItems.excerpt: In this module, learn to create a Logic Apps custom connector to call an API from a Logic Apps workflow.

topItems.title: Create and deploy Logic Apps using Azure Resource Manager templates
topItems.excerpt: Define a Logic Apps workflow declaratively as a Resource Manager template and deploy the app using the Azure Command Line Interface (CLI).

value.title: Build JavaScript applications with Node.js
value.excerpt: Node.js provides a large set of built-in APIs that help you build various types of applications, command-line apps, web apps, and more. It also offers testing and debugging capabilities and a rich ecosystem of third-party packages that you can easily add to your application.

topItems.title: Introduction to Node.js
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Node.js: what it is, how it works, and when to use it. Create Node.js applications using JavaScript/TypeScript using Visual Studio Code.

topItems.title: Create a new Node.js project and work with dependencies
topItems.excerpt: Create a Node.js project and learn to add packages and manage package dependencies in your project. Use the NPM CLI and registry to add libraries and tools to your JavaScript/TypeScript applications using Visual Studio Code.

topItems.title: Interactively debug Node.js apps with the built-in and Visual Studio Code debuggers
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to efficiently debug your Node.js app by using Visual Studio Code to fix your bugs quickly. Use the interactive debugger within Visual Studio Code to analyze and fix your JavaScript/TypeScript applications.

topItems.title: Work with files and directories in a Node.js app
topItems.excerpt: Build an app that manipulates files and directories with Node.js and JavaScript.

value.title: Cloud computing basics for developers
value.excerpt: The first learning path in a course on cloud computing for developers from Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about the basics of the cloud, including the history, building blocks, and types. This learning path prepares developers for real-world cloud practice on Azure.

topItems.title: Foundations of cloud computing for developers
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Discover what the cloud is, the history of cloud computing, what types of clouds are available, and how you might use the cloud.

topItems.title: Economics of cloud computing
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn how developers pay to use the cloud and how cloud providers are able to charge for their services. Get an overview of how the cloud is kept secure.

topItems.title: Datacenter trends in cloud computing
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Datacenters are what power the cloud. Learn what they are, how they work, and challenges in managing them.

topItems.title: Datacenter components
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into datacenters to discover how they are laid out and how computing resources are provisioned and metered.

value.title: Cloud-native security operations with Azure Sentinel
value.excerpt: This learning path describes basic architecture, core capabilities, and primary use cases of its products. You'll also learn about differences and Get familiar with Azure Sentinel, a cloud-native, security information and event management (SIEM) service.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Sentinel
topItems.excerpt: Get familiar with Azure Sentinel, a cloud-native, security information and event management (SIEM) service.

topItems.title: Deploy Azure Sentinel and connect data sources
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to deploy Azure Sentinel and connect the services you want to monitor. Then you can use Azure and AI to provide analysis of security alerts.

topItems.title: Work with models and data in Django

topItems.title: Work with the Django admin site

topItems.title: Create views and templates in Django
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the templating engine in Django to create dynamic HTML. In this module, you'll create views and use template variables, inheritance, and tags.

value.title: Deploy and configure Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machine
value.excerpt: In this learning path, you’ll learn how to deploy and configure Azure IaaS Virtual Machine workloads. After completing the learning path, you’ll know how to plan, deploy, and upgrade Windows Server Azure Virtual Machines.

topItems.title: Plan and deploy Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to describe Azure compute and storage in relation to Azure VMs, and deploy Azure VMs by using the Azure portal, Azure CLI, or templates.

topItems.title: Customize Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machine images
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to create new VMs from generalized images and use Azure Image Builder templates to create and manage images in Azure.

topItems.title: Automate the configuration of Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to deploy Desired State Configuration (DSC) extensions, implement those extensions to remediate noncompliant servers, and use custom script extension.

topItems.title: Upgrade and migrate Windows Server IaaS virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: Learn to migrate a workload running in Windows Server to an infrastructure as a service (IaaS) virtual machine (VM) and to Windows Server 2019 by using Windows Server migration tools or the Storage Migration Service.

value.title: Deploy and manage resources in Azure by using ARM templates
value.excerpt: Learn how ARM templates enable you to manage both basic and complex infrastructure deployments on Azure.

topItems.title: Deploy consistent infrastructure in Azure by using Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates
topItems.excerpt: Write Azure Resource Manager templates by using Visual Studio Code to deploy your infrastructure to Azure consistently and reliably.

topItems.title: Deploy to multiple Azure environments by using ARM templates
topItems.excerpt: Manage multiple Azure environment deployments of your Azure Resource Manager templates by using functions, variables, tags, and parameter files.

topItems.title: Validate your deployments by using what-if and the ARM template test toolkit
topItems.excerpt: Leverage the ARM template test toolkit and apply it on your Azure Resource Manager templates to ensure the templates follow good practices before deployment. Apply the what-if command to see the impact of a deployment before it's applied.

topItems.title: Deploy modular and reusable ARM templates from the command line and by using GitHub Actions
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to deploy Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates by using Azure PowerShell, the Azure CLI, and from GitHub Actions.

value.title: Develop and deploy applications on Kubernetes
value.excerpt: Create, deploy, and maintain Kubernetes-native applications using AKS.

topItems.title: Deploy a containerized application on Azure Kubernetes Service
topItems.excerpt: Explore how to create and deploy a containerized application by using Azure Kubernetes Service declarative manifest files.

topItems.title: Application and package management using Helm
topItems.excerpt: Helm is an application package manager for Kubernetes that you use to standardize and simplify the deployment of cloud-native applications on Kubernetes. Here you'll see how to install third-party packages called Helm charts and how to create and install Helm charts for the workloads your teams develop.

topItems.title: Configure an Azure Kubernetes Service deployment pipeline using GitHub Actions
topItems.excerpt: Explore how to create an automated deployment pipeline by using GitHub Actions along with Azure Kubernetes Service.

topItems.title: Deploy and manage a stateful application using CosmosDB and Azure Kubernetes Service
topItems.excerpt: Create and manage a stateful application with an external storage using CosmosDB and Azure Kubernetes Service
